channel.title: Fixing "100 errors"

item.title: Fixing "100 errors"
item.dc:creator: @smkscape smkscape
item.description:
@smkscape wrote:

Description: Lots of people are posting “Help me I got 100 errors” and also on some replys in tutorial selection “Your tutorial fails I got 100 errors”. So will I hope this tutorial stop all of that questions!

Difficulty: Its just find the line you have error on and find the bracked that is missing or wrong. So I say 1/10

Tested Server: Will work with any server/java script.

I also use proper conventions. So I hope it don’t look messy :P. Also I just made some stupid random codes, I just made this for the brackets and NOT for the codes.

Alright, lets start with the basic.

A bracket is: { and }

The { opens a code and } closes it.

So lets take a simple code:

[size=6pt] public void example() { if (examplelala == 1) { lalala = 1; } } [/size]

You see it open 2 times { and close 2 times }.

So for another example I make this wrong code:

[size=6pt] if(command.equalsIgnoreCase("master")) { for(int i = 0; i < 21; i++) { addSkillXP(14000000, i); } [/size]

Now you see there are 2 open { and only 1 close }.
This will give 100 errors when you are compiling.

So under the last bracket of you the you shoud add {. So then it open 2 times and close 2 times.

Now a larze code, it all the time works exact the same.

[size=6pt] public int getarrowgfxnow() { 1 if (playerEquipment[playerArrows] == 892) { 2 return 15; } 2 if (playerEquipment[playerArrows] == 890) { 3 return 13; } 3 if (playerEquipment[playerArrows] == 888) { 4 return 12; } 4 if (playerEquipment[playerArrows] == 886) { 5 return 11; } 5 if (playerEquipment[playerArrows] == 884) { 6 return 9; } 6 if (playerEquipment[playerArrows] == 882) { 7 return 10; } 7 else { 8 return -1; } 8 } 1 [/size]

You see the int opens. And end on the end. I set a 1 on the begin bracket and a 1 on the end. The others are just opening and closing. You can see this verry easy because I used conversations(also I added figures after evrey bracket so it might be a bit easyer to read, DO NEVER DO THIS IN YOUR REAL CODES LOL just do it in your head there). Two styles of conversations: http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,281929.0.html I am using the first one because its easyer to read in my opinion.

If you use the way I did it you can never get “100 errors”. Also when you are compiling and you got 100 errors it will say in the first error which file the error is in and also the line:

client.java:144: illegal start of expression public int maxedStats = 0; ^

Then go in your client.java and hit Ctrl + G, it open a window where you can type the line, so type it there and hit “ok”. Most of the time it will go to the end of the code where a bracket is missing or wrong.

Thanks for reading, I hope this tutorial was “noobfriendly” and stops the questions for the errors. Also i’m sorry for my english i’m from the Netherlands
